threads.text:
Great phone
Overall love is 5/5.

Rating : 0

No development has started on this device yet. Expected as this is new device.

It's a new device so there is nothing in development 
But in future i think its development will be more as compared to other mid range devices

I noticed that the animation speed on my unit was set to 0.5x and 0.1x and the scrolling was overall choppy. 
Opening and closing apps was the same.
It kind of gave the impression of a really fast phone but with the sacrifice of smoothness.

I've gone and changed the animation speed to 1x and it's behaving more than decently from the developer options.

Just a tip

replies.text: Isn't better with no animation what so ever, no effects? Gets quicker when set off. For me works better this way, no animation.

Yes, I agree it's faster that way, and apps and menus open and close faster but my problem was, being a long time Nexus user is that it gave a noticable choppy feel. I instinctively knew that they've changed the animation speed from the Android default 1x. 
I've since sold the mate and bought the Samsung s8 as it was on a deal and it hardly cost me extra.

By comparing both in terms of app and menu opening speed the mate is faster but not fluid. And that's what bothered me. Fluidity.

threads.text: For me the colours are wayy off grid. Too much color. In automatic mode the photos are worse than those made in automatic mode on LG G2. The colours aren't real.

Video quality is not so good in low light.
It feels like an old camera phone whenever I'm gonna make any video in low light condition

It improves little bit after an update

Video quality? Why should one have a 2k screen resolution and an 16 Mpx sensor and yet not have UHD video recording?
On LG G2 it was disabled but with a mod it got UHD recording and slow motion also.
If someone is able to unlock these features it would be great.

title: Time to take picture (camera launch speed)

threads.text: Takes 2 to 2.5 hours for full charge without using it
5hours max on 4g and gaming. If you only use WiFi, sot will increase. Up to 7 hours.
I'm using the phone for past two weeks now. my screen on time getting me around 6 hours plus. GPS ON, WiFi ON, using 4G mobile data screen on time 5.30 hours.
Sot seems to have improved now and am getting 7.5 hours from 100-15 on continuous usage.

8 hours with heavy usage.
Without heating or lags.

replies.text: How do you really get this long?  my most is around 5 hours
Well...I've recently changed the phone company and I'v noticed that with the new one, in the same usage conditions, I do get less time respect to the times when I was with the previous company.
same. 5 hours or 6.5 hours. from 100 to 15.

threads.text: 9 hrs. Straight from 100% to 0%. No lag no heat.
Can reach upto 7.5 hours with heavy usage.
I just wish they'd put the Huawei logo at the back for a much cleaner look.

The phone definitely feels solid in the hand. 

I just want to add that the finish/paint(?) at the back easily gets scratched specially the camera area. So be careful when laying down your phone and might as well get a case that raises the camera bump. The included clear case doesn't do much since it's leveled with the camera.

I think the color saturation and accuracy is all over the place, at least out of the box.
I'm not sure yet if it's the display of the unit or the way it's calibrated, or if it's just me, coming from an AMOLED display.

I've played around with the settings in display>color temperature and I've found that if you set the temperature to 12 o'clock it's better. At least the greens and reds don't look washed up anymore.
Attached a screenshot of my settings.

That being said is there anyone that can share some tips on correctly calibrating the colors of this display or is this simply a really cheap LCD unit?

For comparisons, regardless of the settings, the now  similarly priced p10 has a better looking display ( I paid around 50$ less for this one than what the p10 was priced at the time).

Just my 2cents.
Forgot the screenshot of my color settings

Maybe wanna try this. I haven't tried it but it looks like gets the job done.

https://play.google.com/store/apps/d...laycalibration

I have honor 8, device is pretty good in term of use, but i found WiFi range is not that good.
MI phone has better range over WiFi.
